verses.verse: <S%H136>Lord<s%>, you have been our living <S%H4583>place<s%> in <S%H1755>all<s%> <S%H1755>generations<s%>.

Before the <S%H2022>mountains<s%> were brought <S%H3205>forth<s%>, or ever you had <S%H2342>formed<s%> the <S%H776>earth<s%> and the <S%H8398>world<s%>, even from <S%H5769>everlasting<s%> <S%H5704>to<s%> <S%H5769>everlasting<s%>, you are <S%H410>God<s%>.

For a <S%H505>thousand<s%> <S%H8141>years<s%> in your <S%H5869>sight<s%> are but <S%H3117>as<s%> <S%H865>yesterday<s%> when it is <S%H5674>past<s%>, and as a <S%H821>watch<s%> in the <S%H3915>night<s%>.
You carry them away as with a <S%H2229>flood<s%>; they are as a <S%H8142>sleep<s%>: in the <S%H1242>morning<s%> they are like <S%H2682>grass<s%> which grows <S%H2498>up<s%>.
In the <S%H1242>morning<s%> it <S%H6692>flourishes<s%>, and grows <S%H2498>up<s%>; in the <S%H6153>evening<s%> it is cut <S%H4135>down<s%>, and <S%H3001>withers<s%>.
For we are <S%H3615>consumed<s%> by your <S%H639>anger<s%>, and by your <S%H2534>wrath<s%> are we <S%H926>troubled<s%>.
You have <S%H7896>set<s%> our <S%H5771>iniquities<s%> before <S%H5956>you<s%>, our secret sins in the <S%H3974>light<s%> of your <S%H6440>favor<s%>.
For all our <S%H3117>days<s%> are passed <S%H6437>away<s%> in your <S%H5678>wrath<s%>: we <S%H3615>spend<s%> our <S%H8141>years<s%> as a number that is <S%H1899>told<s%>.

The <S%H3117>days<s%> of our <S%H8141>years<s%> are <S%H7657>sixty<s%> <S%H8141>years<s%> and <S%H7657>ten<s%>; and if by reason of <S%H1369>strength<s%> they be <S%H8084>eighty<s%> <S%H8141>years<s%>, yet is their <S%H7296>strength<s%> <S%H5999>labor<s%> and <S%H205>sorrow<s%>; for it is <S%H2440>soon<s%> cut <S%H1468>off<s%>, and we fly <S%H5774>away<s%>.
Who <S%H3045>knows<s%> the <S%H5797>power<s%> of your <S%H639>anger<s%>? even according to your <S%H3374>fear<s%>, so is your <S%H5678>wrath<s%>.
So <S%H3045>teach<s%> us to <S%H4487>number<s%> our <S%H3117>days<s%>, that we may <S%H935>apply<s%> our <S%H3824>hearts<s%> unto <S%H2451>wisdom<s%>.
<S%H7725>Return<s%>, O <S%H3068>Lord<s%>, how <S%H5162>long<s%>? and have pity concerning your <S%H5650>servants<s%>.
O <S%H7646>satisfy<s%> us <S%H1242>early<s%> with your <S%H2617>mercy<s%>; that we may <S%H7442>rejoice<s%> and be <S%H8055>glad<s%> all our <S%H3117>days<s%>.
Make us <S%H8055>glad<s%> according to the <S%H3117>days<s%> where you have <S%H6031>afflicted<s%> <S%H8141>us<s%>, and the years where we have <S%H7200>seen<s%> <S%H7451>evil<s%>.
Let your <S%H6467>work<s%> <S%H7200>appear<s%> unto your <S%H5650>servants<s%>, and your <S%H1926>glory<s%> unto their <S%H1121>sons<s%>.

And let the <S%H5278>beauty<s%> of the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> our <S%H430>God<s%> be upon <S%H3559>us<s%>: and establish you the <S%H4639>work<s%> of our <S%H3027>hands<s%> upon <S%H4639>us<s%>; Yes, the work of our <S%H3027>hands<s%> <S%H3559>establish<s%>.
